body.p: While the boards reached many common decisions, as a result of this scope difference, and other jurisdictional differences, the IASB and the FASB came to different decisions in a number of areas. These include:

li.p: whether there should be a requirement that an investment entity measure and evaluate substantially all of its investments on a fair value basis rather than identifying such an activity as a typical characteristic of an investment entity;
whether there should be a reference to existing regulatory requirements in the definition of an investment entity;
whether an investment entity is permitted to provide investment-related services to third parties other than its own investors;
the accounting by an investment entity parent for an investment entity subsidiary; and
the accounting by a non-investment entity parent for an investment entity subsidiary.
